sense.name: an audible vibration through a medium
sense.examples: We could hear the sound of the rain falling on the roof. Sound travels well through the water. There were strange sounds coming from the engine. He awoke to the sound of a brass band playing 'Joy to the World'. In the vacuum of deep space, the explosion would make no sound.

sense.name: a transmitted transformed audio signal, e.g., as in a TV broadcast
sense.commentary: SOUND[+force][+signal][+transformed][+audio][+transmitted] Note: related to Sense 1, but implies an electrically transmitted audio signal.
sense.examples: An engineer monitored the sound segment of the television program. He worked in sound for several different recording studios. John adjusted the knobs to balance the sound system.

sense.name: speech units, phones
sense.examples: The first speech sounds the child heard were in French. It's a sound similar to an English 'p', but softer, without the aspiration.

sense.name: a narrow channel or span of a sea or ocean
sense.examples: Winds coming from the Atlantic can whip up large waves in the sound off Long Island. The main body of the sound ran parallel to the coast. They enjoyed sailing in the sound during the summer months.

sense.name: an area, location, within audible range of something
sense.examples: The dog had roamed into the woods beyond the sound of my voice. The lightening is close enough that we're within the sound of it.

sense.name: a mental impression, idea
sense.examples: From the sounds of it, John really loved his vacation in Italy. I don't like the sound of your suggestion - it would be dangerous! By the sound of it, I conclude you don't want to go for sushi tonight?

sense.name: a musical style or effect
sense.examples: Their band has a different sound from any I've ever heard. She likes the Motown sound a lot. The composer created a dark sound in his third symphony.

sense.name: a long surgical probe
sense.examples: The surgeon examined the inflamed tissue with a sound.
